<body style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" 
bgcolor="#ffffff" text="#000000">
<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">EXHIBIT 31.1</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CERTIFICATION</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I, Robert E. Swanson, certify that:</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">1.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I have 
reviewed this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q of Ridgewood Energy A-1 Fund, 
LLC;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">2.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Based on 
my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material 
fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in 
light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading
with respect to the period covered by this report;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">3.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Based on 
my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included
in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition,
results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the 
periods presented in this report;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">4.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The 
registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for 
establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in 
Exchange Act Rules 13a &#8211; 15(e) and 15d &#8211; 15(e)) and internal control
over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a &#8211; 15(f) and
15d &#8211; 15(f)) for the registrant and have:</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Designed 
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and 
procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material 
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries,
is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the 
period in which this report is being prepared;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Designed 
such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control 
over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide 
reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the 
preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with 
generally accepted accounting principles;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(c)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Evaluated 
the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures 
and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the 
disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this 
report based on such evaluation; and</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(d)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Disclosed 
in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over 
financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent 
fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an 
annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to 
materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial 
reporting; and</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">5.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The 
registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on 
our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the 
registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s 
board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent 
functions):</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">All 
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of 
internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to 
adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize 
and report financial information; and</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any fraud,
whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a 
significant role in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial 
reporting.</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id="z3c19b3e85f7a4275af29924e667d5dcb" 
border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Dated:</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">August 9, 2016</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 50%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 50%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">/s/</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
top">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">ROBERT E. SWANSON</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 50%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Name:</div>
</td>

<body style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" 
bgcolor="#ffffff" text="#000000">
<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">EXHIBIT 31.2</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CERTIFICATION</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I, Kathleen P. McSherry, certify that:</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">1.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I have 
reviewed this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q of Ridgewood Energy A-1 Fund, 
LLC;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">2.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Based on 
my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material 
fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in 
light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading
with respect to the period covered by this report;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">3.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Based on 
my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included
in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition,
results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the 
periods presented in this report;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">4.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The 
registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for 
establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in 
Exchange Act Rules 13a &#8211; 15(e) and 15d &#8211; 15(e)) and internal control
over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a &#8211; 15(f) and
15d &#8211; 15(f)) for the registrant and have:</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a) </font>&#160;<font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Designed 
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and 
procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material 
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries,
is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the 
period in which this report is being prepared;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Designed 
such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control 
over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide 
reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the 
preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with 
generally accepted accounting principles;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(c)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Evaluated 
the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures 
and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the 
disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this 
report based on such evaluation; and</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(d)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Disclosed 
in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over 
financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent 
fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an 
annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to 
materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial 
reporting; and</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">5.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The 
registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on 
our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the 
registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s 
board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent 
functions):</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">All 
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of 
internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to 
adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize 
and report financial information; and</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any fraud,
whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a 
significant role in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial 
reporting.</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>

</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>

2002</div>
<div><br>
</div>

</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif;

Ridgewood Energy A-1 Fund, LLC (the &#8220;Fund&#8221;) for the period ended

hereof, (the &#8220;Report&#8221;), each of the undersigned officers of the Fund
hereby certifies, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. (section) 1350, as adopted pursuant to

knowledge:</div>

gaap:OrganizationConsolidationBasisOfPresentationBusinessDescriptionAndAccountin
gPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div style="text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;table id="z4ff9a0dbd91a48bb99d92ab82ed79ed4" 
class="DSPFListTable" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%; font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 
36pt; font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; vertical-align: 
top"&gt;1.&lt;/td&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="text-align: justify; width: auto; font: 
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; vertical-align: top"&gt;Organization 
and Summary of Significant Accounting 
Policies&lt;/td&gt;&#13;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13
;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
left; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; color: 
#000000"&gt;Organization&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Ridgewood Energy A-1 
Fund, LLC (the "Fund"), a Delaware limited liability company, was formed on 
February 3, 2009 and operates pursuant to a limited liability company agreement 
(the &amp;#8220;LLC Agreement") dated as of March 2, 2009 by and among Ridgewood
Energy Corporation (the "Manager") and the shareholders of the Fund, which 
addresses matters such as the authority and voting rights of the Manager and 
shareholders, capitalization, transferability of membership interests, 
participation in costs and revenues, distribution of assets and dissolution and 
winding up.&amp;#160; The Fund was organized to primarily acquire interests in 
oil and gas properties located in the United States offshore waters of Texas, 
Louisiana and Alabama in the Gulf of 
Mexico.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Manager has direct and exclusive control 
over the management of the Fund's operations. With respect to project 
investments, the Manager locates potential projects, conducts due diligence, and
negotiates and completes the transactions. The Manager performs, or arranges for
the performance of, the management, advisory and administrative services 
required for Fund operations. Such services include, without limitation, the 
administration of shareholder accounts, shareholder relations and the 
preparation, review and dissemination of tax and other financial 
information.&amp;#160; In addition, the Manager provides office space, equipment
and facilities and other services necessary for Fund operations.&amp;#160; The 
Manager also engages and manages the contractual relations with unaffiliated
custodians, depositories, accountants, attorneys, broker-dealers, corporate 
fiduciaries, insurers, banks and others as required.&amp;#160; See Notes 2, 3 
and 4.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Basis of 
Presentation&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;These unaudited interim condensed financial 
statements have been prepared by the Fund&amp;#8217;s management in accordance 
with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America 
(&amp;#8220;GAAP&amp;#8221;) and in the opinion of management, contain all 
adjustments (consisting of only normal recurring adjustments) necessary to 
present fairly the Fund&amp;#8217;s financial position, results of operations 
and cash flows for the periods presented.&amp;#160; Certain information and note
disclosures normally included in annual financial statements prepared in 
accordance with GAAP have been omitted in these unaudited interim condensed 
financial statements.&amp;#160; The results of operations, financial position, 
and cash flows for the periods presented herein are not necessarily indicative 
of future financial results.&amp;#160; These unaudited interim condensed 
financial statements should be read in conjunction with the Fund&amp;#8217;s 
December 31, 2015 financial statements and notes thereto included in the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K filed with the Securities and 
Exchange Commission (&amp;#8220;SEC&amp;#8221;).&amp;#160; The year-end 
condensed balance sheet data was derived from audited financial statements for 
the year ended December 31, 2015, but does not include all disclosures required 
by GAAP.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Use of 
Estimates&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The preparation of financial statements in 
accordance with GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that 
affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of 
contingent assets and liabilities as of the date of the financial statements and
the reported amounts of revenue and expense during the reporting period. On an 
ongoing basis, the Manager reviews its estimates, including those related to the
fair value of financial instruments, net property balances, determination of 
proved reserves, impairment of long-lived assets and asset retirement 
obligations.&amp;#160; Actual results may differ from those 
estimates.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;d
iv style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;Fair Value Measurements&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-
align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The fair value 
measurement guidance provides a hierarchy that prioritizes and defines the types
of inputs used to measure fair value. The fair value hierarchy gives the highest
priority to Level 1 inputs, which consists of unadjusted quoted prices for 
identical instruments in active markets. Level 2 inputs consist of quoted prices
for similar instruments.&amp;#160; Level 3 inputs are unobservable inputs and 
include situations where there is little, if any, market activity for the 
instrument; hence, these inputs have the lowest priority.&amp;#160; Mortgage-
backed securities are recorded based on Level 2 inputs, as such instruments 
trade in over-the-counter markets.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-
align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Cash and Cash 
Equivalents&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;All highly liquid investments with maturities,
when purchased, of three months or less, are considered cash equivalents. These 
balances, as well as cash on hand, are included in &amp;#8220;Cash and cash 
equivalents&amp;#8221; on the balance sheet. As of June 30, 2016, the Fund had 
no cash equivalents. At times, deposits may be in excess of federally insured 
limits, which are $250 thousand per insured financial institution.&amp;#160; As 
of June 30, 2016, the Fund&amp;#8217;s bank balances were maintained in 
uninsured bank accounts at Wells Fargo Bank, 
N.A.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Salvage 
Fund&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif; color: #000000"&gt;The Fund deposits in a separate 
interest-bearing account, or salvage fund, money to provide for the dismantling 
and removal of production platforms and facilities and plugging and abandoning 
its wells at the end of their useful lives, in accordance with applicable 
federal and state laws and regulations.&amp;#160; As of June 30, 2016 and 
December 31, 2015, the Fund had investments in federal agency mortgage-backed 
securities as detailed in the following table, which are classified as available
for sale.&amp;#160; Available-for-sale securities are carried in the financial 
statements at fair value.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table

$&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="text-align: right; background-
color: #ffffff; width: 9%; vertical-align: bottom; vertical-align: 
bottom"&gt;&#13;&lt;div style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;78&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;&lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="text-
align: left; background-color: #ffffff; width: 1%; vertical-align: bottom; 
vertical-align: 
bottom"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt
;div style="clear: both"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-
align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The unrealized 
gains on the Fund's investments in federal agency mortgage-backed securities 
were the result of fluctuations in market interest rates. The contractual cash 
flows of those investments are guaranteed by an agency of the U.S. 
government.&amp;#160; Unrealized gains or losses on available-for-sale 
securities are reported in other comprehensive income until 
realized.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times
 New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;For all investments, interest income is accrued as 
earned and amortization of premium or discount, if any, is included in interest 
income.&amp;#160; Interest earned on the account will become part of the salvage
fund.&amp;#160; There are no restrictions on withdrawals from the salvage 
fund.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Debt Discounts and Deferred 
Financing Costs&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Debt discounts and deferred financing 
costs include lender fees and other costs of acquiring debt (see Note 3. 
&amp;#8220;Credit Agreement &amp;#8211; Beta Project Financing&amp;#8221;) such 
as the conveyance of override royalty interests related to the Beta 
Project.&amp;#160; These costs are deferred and amortized over the term of the 
debt period or until the redemption of the debt. During the first quarter of 
2016, the Fund adopted the accounting guidance issued in April 2015 related to 
the presentation of debt issuance costs on the balance sheet as a direct 
reduction from the carrying amount of the debt liability, rather than as an
asset. As a result, the unamortized debt discounts and deferred financing costs 
of $0.2 million as of June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015 are presented 
as&amp;#160;a reduction of &amp;#8220;Long-term borrowings&amp;#8221; on the 
balance sheets. Amortization expense was $31 thousand during each of the three 
months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015. Amortization expense was $0.1 million 
during each of the six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015.&amp;#160; During the
period of asset construction, amortization expense, as a component of interest, 
is capitalized and included on the balance sheet within &amp;#8220;Oil and gas 
properties&amp;#8221;.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Oil and Gas 
Properties&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund invests in oil and gas properties, 
which are operated by unaffiliated entities that are responsible for drilling, 
administering and producing activities pursuant to the terms of the applicable 
operating agreements with working interest owners. The Fund&amp;#8217;s portion 
of exploration, drilling, operating and capital equipment expenditures is billed
by operators.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Exploration, development and acquisition costs
are accounted for using the successful efforts method. Costs of acquiring 
unproved and proved oil and natural gas leasehold acreage, including lease 
bonuses, brokers&amp;#8217; fees and other related costs are capitalized. Costs 
of drilling and equipping productive wells and related production facilities are
capitalized.&amp;#160; The costs of exploratory wells are capitalized pending 
determination of whether proved reserves have been found. If proved commercial 
reserves are not found, exploratory well costs are expensed as dry-hole 
costs.&amp;#160; At times, the Fund receives adjustments to certain wells from 
their respective operators upon review and audit of the wells&amp;#8217; 
costs.&amp;#160; Interest costs related to the Credit Agreement (see Note 3. 
&amp;#8220;Credit Agreement &amp;#8211; Beta Project Financing&amp;#8221;) are 
capitalized during the period of asset construction.&amp;#160; Annual lease 
rentals and exploration expenses are expensed as incurred.&amp;#160; All costs 
related to production activity and workover efforts are expensed as 
incurred.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Once a well has been 
determined to be fully depleted or upon the sale, retirement or abandonment of a
property, the cost and related accumulated depletion and amortization, if any, 
is eliminated from the property accounts, and the resultant gain or loss is 
recognized.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;As of June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015, 
amounts recorded in due to operators totaling $0.3 million and $0.1 million, 
respectively, related to capital expenditures for oil and gas 
properties.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 
&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Advances to Operators for Working Interests 
and Expenditures&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund may be required to advance its 
share of the estimated succeeding month&amp;#8217;s expenditures to the operator
for its oil and gas properties. As the costs are incurred, the advances are 
reclassified to proved properties.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Asset Retirement 
Obligations&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;For oil and gas properties, there are 
obligations to perform removal and remediation activities when the properties 
are retired. Upon the determination of a property to be either proved or dry, a 
retirement obligation is incurred. The Fund recognizes the fair value of a 
liability for an asset retirement obligation in the period incurred.&amp;#160; 
Plug and abandonment costs associated with unsuccessful projects are expensed as
dry-hole costs.&amp;#160; As indicated above, the Fund maintains a salvage fund 
to provide for the funding of asset retirement 
obligations.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Syndication 
Costs&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Syndication costs are direct costs incurred by the 
Fund in connection with the offering of the Fund&amp;#8217;s shares, including 
professional fees, selling expenses and administrative costs payable to the 
Manager, an affiliate of the Manager and unaffiliated broker-dealers, which are 
reflected on the Fund&amp;#8217;s balance sheet as a reduction of 
shareholders&amp;#8217; capital.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Revenue Recognition and 
Imbalances&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Oil and gas revenues are recognized when oil 
and gas is sold to a purchaser at a fixed or determinable price, when delivery 
has occurred and title has transferred, and collectability of the revenue is 
reasonably assured.&amp;#160; The Fund uses the sales method of accounting for 
gas production imbalances.&amp;#160; The volumes of gas sold may differ from the
volumes to which the Fund is entitled based on its interests in the 
properties.&amp;#160; These differences create imbalances that are recognized as
a liability only when the properties&amp;#8217; estimated remaining reserves net
to the Fund will not be sufficient to enable the underproduced owner to recoup 
its entitled share through production.&amp;#160; The Fund&amp;#8217;s recorded 
liability, if any, would be reflected in other liabilities.&amp;#160; No 
receivables are recorded for those wells where the Fund has taken less than its 
share of production.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived 
Assets&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund reviews the carrying value of its oil and 
gas properties annually and when management determines that events and 
circumstances indicate that the recorded carrying value of properties may not be
recoverable.&amp;#160; Impairments are determined by comparing estimated future 
net undiscounted cash flows to the carrying value at the time of the 
review.&amp;#160; If the carrying value exceeds the estimated future net 
undiscounted cash flows, the carrying value of the asset is written down to fair
value, which is determined using estimated future net discounted cash flows from
the asset.&amp;#160; The fair value determinations require considerable judgment
and are sensitive to change.&amp;#160; Different pricing assumptions, reserve 
estimates or discount rates could result in a different calculated 
impairment.&amp;#160; Given the volatility of oil and natural gas prices, it is 
reasonably possible that the Fund&amp;#8217;s estimate of discounted future net 
cash flows from proved oil and natural gas reserves could change in the near 
term.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Significant declines in oil and natural gas 
prices since fourth quarter 2014 have impacted the fair value of the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s oil and gas properties. If oil and natural gas prices continue 
to decline, even if only for a short period of time, it is possible that 
impairments
 of oil and gas properties will occur.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Depletion and 
Amortization&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Depletion and amortization of the cost of 
proved oil and gas properties are calculated using the units-of-production 
method.&amp;#160; Proved developed reserves are used as the base for depleting 
capitalized costs associated with successful exploratory well costs, development
costs and related facilities. The sum of proved developed and proved undeveloped
reserves is used as the base for depleting or amortizing leasehold acquisition 
costs.&amp;#160; During the three and six months ended June 30, 2015, the Fund 
recorded $0.6 million of depletion expense related to adjustments to asset
retirement obligations for fully depleted 
properties.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13
;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-
align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;No provision is 
made for income taxes in the financial statements.&amp;#160; The Fund is a 
limited liability company, and as such, the Fund&amp;#8217;s income or loss is 
passed through and included in the tax returns of the Fund&amp;#8217;s 
shareholders.&amp;#160; The Fund files U.S. Federal and State tax returns and 
the 2013 through 2015 tax returns remain open for examination by tax 
authorities.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Income and Expense 
Allocation&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Profits and losses are allocated to 
shareholders and the Manager in accordance with the LLC 
Agreement.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;Distributions&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify;
font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Distributions to shareholders are 
allocated in proportion to the number of shares held.&amp;#160; The Manager 
determines whether available cash from operations, as defined in the LLC 
Agreement, will be distributed. Such distributions are allocated 85% to the 
shareholders and 15% to the Manager, as required by the LLC 
Agreement.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Available cash from dispositions, as defined 
in the LLC Agreement, will be paid 99% to shareholders and 1% to the Manager 
until the shareholders have received total distributions equal to their capital 
contributions. After shareholders have received distributions equal to their 
capital contributions, 85% of available cash from dispositions will be 
distributed to shareholders and 15% to the 
Manager.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: left; font: italic 
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Recent Accounting 
Pronouncements&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;In April 2015, the Financial Accounting 
Standards Board (&amp;#8220;FASB&amp;#8221;) issued accounting guidance related 
to the presentation of debt issuance costs on the balance sheet as a direct 
reduction from the carrying amount of the debt liability, consistent with debt 
discounts, rather than as an asset.&amp;#160; Amortization of debt issuance 
costs will continue to be reported as interest expense.&amp;#160; In August 
2015, the FASB issued accounting guidance related to the presentation and 
subsequent measurement of debt issuance costs associated with line-of-credit 
arrangements which clarifies that companies may continue to present unamortized 
debt issuance costs associated with line of credit arrangements as an 
asset.&amp;#160; These pronouncements are effective for fiscal years, and 
interim periods within those years, beginning after December 15, 2015, with 
early adoption permitted.&amp;#160; The Fund adopted the accounting guidance in 
first quarter 2016, resulting in a one-time reclassification of $0.2 million of 
unamortized debt discounts and deferred financing costs from "Other assets" to 
"Long-term borrowings" on the balance sheet as of December 31, 2015. Long-term 
borrowings are presented net of $0.2 million of unamortized debt discounts and 
deferred financing costs as of June 30, 2016. The adoption of these 
pronouncements did not impact the Fund&amp;#8217;s results of operations or cash
flows.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;In 2014, the FASB issued accounting guidance 
on revenue recognition, which provides for a single five-step model to be 
applied to all revenue contracts with customers. In 2015, the FASB issued a 
deferral of the effective date of the guidance to 2018, with early adoption 
permitted in 2017. In May 2016, the FASB issued final amendments which provided 
narrow scope improvements and practical expedients related to the implementation
of the guidance. The Fund is currently evaluating the impact of this guidance on
its financial statements&lt;/div&gt;</us-

gPoliciesTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-

id="z2f1ad894de104929b03067fcf21f1d6f" class="DSPFListTable" cellspacing="0"

serif"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 36pt; font: bold 10pt Times

style="text-align: justify; width: auto; font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
serif; vertical-align: top"&gt;Related 
Parties&lt;/td&gt;&#13;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Pursuant to the terms of 
the LLC Agreement, the Manager renders management, administrative and advisory 
services to the Fund.&amp;#160; For such services, the Manager is entitled to an
annual management fee, payable monthly, of 2.5% of total capital contributions, 
net of cumulative dry-hole and related well costs incurred by the 
Fund.&amp;#160; Management fees during each of the three and six months ended 
June 30, 2016 and 2015 were $0.1 million and $0.2 million, 
respectively.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&l
t;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;The Manager is entitled to receive a 15% interest in cash 
distributions from operations made by the Fund.&amp;#160; The Fund did not pay 
distributions during the three and six months ended June 30, 2016 and during the
three months ended June 30, 2015. Distributions paid to the Manager during the 
six months ended June 30, 2015 were $13 
thousand.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;di
v style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;At 
times, short-term payables and receivables, which do not bear interest, arise 
from transactions with affiliates in the ordinary course of 
business.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;None of the amounts paid to the Manager have 
been derived as a result of arm&amp;#8217;s length 
negotiations.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund has working interest ownership in 
certain projects to acquire and develop oil and natural gas projects with other 
entities that are likewise managed by the Manager.&lt;/div&gt;</us-

    <us-gaap:DebtDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-
30">&lt;div style="text-align: left"&gt;&lt;table 
id="zeb49c8fb0c5d46c7a20c33eae0623b5d" class="DSPFListTable" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 36pt; font: bold 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif; vertical-align: top"&gt;3.&lt;/td&gt;&#13;&lt;td 
style="text-align: left; width: auto; font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif; vertical-align: top"&gt;Credit Agreement &amp;#8211; Beta Project 
Financing&lt;/td&gt;&#13;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#1
3;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;In November 2012, the Fund
entered into a credit agreement (the &amp;#8220;Credit Agreement&amp;#8221;) 
with Rahr Energy Investments LLC, as Administrative Agent and Lender (and any 
other banks or financial institutions that may in the future become a party 
thereto, collectively &amp;#8220;Lenders&amp;#8221;) that provides for an 
aggregate loan commitment to the Fund of approximately $8.3 million 
(&amp;#8220;Loan&amp;#8221;), to provide capital toward the funding of the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s share of development costs on the Beta Project. Except in cases
of fraud and breach of certain representations, the Loan is non-recourse to the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s other assets and secured solely by the Fund&amp;#8217;s 
interests in the Beta Project. Certain other funds managed by Ridgewood 
(&amp;#8220;Ridgewood Funds&amp;#8221;, and when used with the Fund the
&amp;#8220;Ridgewood Participating Funds&amp;#8221;) have also executed the 
Credit Agreement. Pursuant to the Credit Agreement, each Ridgewood Participating
Fund has a separate loan commitment from the Lenders and amounts borrowed are 
not joint and several obligations. Each of the Ridgewood Participating 
Funds&amp;#8217; borrowings is secured solely by its separate interest in the 
Beta Project. Therefore, the Fund is liable for the repayment of its Loan and is
not liable to the Lenders to repay any loan made to any other Ridgewood Funds. 
The Manager serves as the manager for each of the Ridgewood Participating 
Funds.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund anticipates it will borrow 
approximately $8.3 million over the development period of the Beta Project. The 
Loan bears interest at 8% compounded annually and accrues only on Loan proceeds 
as they are drawn. Principal and interest will not be payable until such time 
that initial production has commenced for the Beta Project, which commenced 
production in third quarter 2016.&amp;#160; At that time, if certain revenue 
production levels are met, principal and interest will be repaid at a monthly 
rate of 1.25% of the Fund&amp;#8217;s total principal outstanding at the date 
the Beta Project commences production for the first seven months of production, 
and a monthly rate of 4.5% of the Fund&amp;#8217;s total principal outstanding 
at the date the Beta Project commences production thereafter until the Loan is 
repaid in full, in no event later than December 31, 2020.&amp;#160; The Loan may
be prepaid by the Fund without premium or 
penalty.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;As of June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015, the
Fund had borrowings of $2.9 million under the Credit Agreement. During the first
quarter of 2016, the Fund adopted the accounting guidance issued in April 2015 
related to the presentation of debt issuance costs on the balance sheet as a 
direct reduction from the carrying amount of the debt liability, rather than as 
an asset. As a result, the unamortized debt discounts and deferred financing 
costs of $0.2 million as of June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015 are presented as
a reduction of &amp;#8220;Long-term borrowings&amp;#8221; on the balance 
sheets.&amp;#160; As of June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015, interest costs of 
$0.4 million and $0.3 million, respectively, were capitalized and included on 
the balance sheet within &amp;#8220;Oil and gas properties&amp;#8221;.&amp;#160;
Such amounts are accrued on the balance sheet within &amp;#8220;Accrued 
expenses&amp;#8221; as of June 30, 2016 and &amp;#8220;Accrued 
expenses&amp;#8221; and &amp;#8220;Other liabilities&amp;#8221; as of December 
31, 2015.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;As additional consideration to the Lenders, 
the Fund has agreed to convey an overriding royalty interest 
(&amp;#8220;ORRI&amp;#8221;) in its working interest in the Beta Project to the 
Lenders.&amp;#160; The Credit Agreement contains customary covenants, for which 
the Fund believes it was in compliance as of June 30, 2016 and December 31, 
2015.&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:DebtDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="D2016-
01-01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div style="text-align: left"&gt;&lt;table 
id="z893409cc2a574da08de3d340a9939c29" class="DSPFListTable" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 36pt; font: bold 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif; vertical-align: top"&gt;4.&lt;/td&gt;&#13;&lt;td 
style="text-align: left; width: auto; font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif; vertical-align: top"&gt;Commitments and 
Contingencies&lt;/td&gt;&#13;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13
;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-
align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Capital
Commitments&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund has entered into multiple agreements 
for the acquisition, drilling and development of its oil and gas properties. The
estimated capital expenditures associated with these agreements vary depending 
on the stage of development on a property-by-property basis.&amp;#160; As of 
June 30, 2016, the Fund had one property, the Beta Project, for which additional
development costs must be incurred in order to commence production. The Fund 
currently expects to spend an additional $4.5 million (which includes asset 
retirement obligations) related to the development of the Beta Project, which 
the Fund anticipates will include the development of four wells with related 
platform and pipeline infrastructure.&amp;#160;During third quarter 2016, one 
well in the Beta Project commenced 
production.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;As of June 30, 2016, the Fund&amp;#8217;s 
estimated capital commitments related to its oil and gas properties were $6.3 
million (which include asset retirement obligations for the Fund&amp;#8217;s 
projects of $2.7 million and projected interest costs of $21 thousand for the 
Beta Project), of which $3.3 million is expected to be spent during the next 
twelve months. These expected capital commitments exceed available working 
capital and salvage fund by $5.2 million as of June 30, 2016.&amp;#160; The Fund
has entered into the Credit Agreement to provide capital for funding of the Beta
Project.&amp;#160; See Note 3. &amp;#8220;Credit Agreement &amp;#8211; Beta 
Project Financing&amp;#8221; for additional 
information.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt
;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;Based upon its current cash position, its current reserve estimates 
and its current development plan of the Beta Project, the Fund expects cash flow
from operations and borrowings to be sufficient to cover its commitments, as 
well as ongoing operations. Reserve estimates are projections based on 
engineering data that cannot be measured with precision, require substantial 
judgment, and are subject to frequent revision.&amp;#160; However, if cash flow 
from operations is not sufficient to meet the Fund&amp;#8217;s capital 
commitments, the Manager will take action, which may include adjusting its 
management fee temporarily to accommodate the Fund&amp;#8217;s short-term 
capital commitments.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; 
font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Environmental 
Considerations&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The exploration for and development of 
oil and natural gas involves the extraction, production and transportation of 
materials which, under certain conditions, can be hazardous or cause 
environmental pollution problems.&amp;#160; The Manager and operators of the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s properties are continually taking action they believe 
appropriate to satisfy applicable federal, state and local environmental 
regulations and do not currently anticipate that compliance with federal, state 
and local environmental regulations will have a material adverse effect upon 
capital expenditures, results of operations or the competitive position of the 
Fund in the oil and gas industry.&amp;#160; However, due to the significant 
public and governmental interest in environmental matters related to those 
activities, the Manager cannot predict the effects of possible future 
legislation, rule changes, or governmental or private claims.&amp;#160; As of 
June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015, there were no known environmental 
contingencies that required adjustment to, or disclosure in, the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s financial statements.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;During the past several years, the United 
States Congress, as well as certain regulatory agencies with jurisdiction over 
the Fund&amp;#8217;s business, have considered or proposed legislation or 
regulation relating to the upstream oil and gas industry both onshore and 
offshore.&amp;#160; If any such proposals were to be enacted or adopted they 
could potentially materially impact the Fund&amp;#8217;s operations.&amp;#160; 
It is not possible at this time to predict whether such legislation or 
regulation, if proposed, will be adopted as initially written, if at all, or how
legislation or new regulation that may be adopted would impact the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s business. Any such future laws and regulations could result in 
increased compliance costs or additional operating restrictions, which could 
have a material adverse effect on the Fund&amp;#8217;s operating results and 
cash flows.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Insurance 
Coverage&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund is subject to all risks inherent in 
the exploration for and development of oil and natural gas. Insurance coverage 
as is customary for entities engaged in similar operations is maintained, but 
losses may occur from uninsurable risks or amounts in excess of existing 
insurance coverage.&amp;#160; The occurrence of an event that is not insured or 
not fully insured could have a material adverse impact upon earnings and 
financial position.&amp;#160; Moreover, insurance is obtained as a package 
covering all of the funds managed by the Manager.&amp;#160; Claims made by other
funds managed by the Manager can reduce or eliminate insurance for the 
Fund.&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-
01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Basis of 
Presentation&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;These unaudited interim condensed financial 
statements have been prepared by the Fund&amp;#8217;s management in accordance 
with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America 
(&amp;#8220;GAAP&amp;#8221;) and in the opinion of management, contain all 
adjustments (consisting of only normal recurring adjustments) necessary to 
present fairly the Fund&amp;#8217;s financial position, results of operations 
and cash flows for the periods presented.&amp;#160; Certain information and note
disclosures normally included in annual financial statements prepared in 
accordance with GAAP have been omitted in these unaudited interim condensed 
financial statements.&amp;#160; The results of operations, financial position, 
and cash flows for the periods presented herein are not necessarily indicative 
of future financial results.&amp;#160; These unaudited interim condensed 
financial statements should be read in conjunction with the Fund&amp;#8217;s 
December 31, 2015 financial statements and notes thereto included in the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K filed with the Securities and 
Exchange Commission (&amp;#8220;SEC&amp;#8221;).&amp;#160; The year-end 
condensed balance sheet data was derived from audited financial statements for 
the year ended December 31, 2015, but does not include all disclosures required 
by GAAP.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:UseOfEstimates contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-
30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 
italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Use of 
Estimates&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The preparation of financial statements in 
accordance with GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that 
affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of 
contingent assets and liabilities as of the date of the financial statements and
the reported amounts of revenue and expense during the reporting period. On an 
ongoing basis, the Manager reviews its estimates, including those related to the
fair value of financial instruments, net property balances, determination of 
proved reserves, impairment of long-lived assets and asset retirement 
obligations.&amp;#160; Actual results may differ from those 
estimates.&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:UseOfEstimates>
    <us-gaap:FairValueMeasurementPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-
01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Fair Value 
Measurements&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The fair value measurement guidance provides a
hierarchy that prioritizes and defines the types of inputs used to measure fair 
value. The fair value hierarchy gives the highest priority to Level 1 inputs, 
which consists of unadjusted quoted prices for identical instruments in active 
markets. Level 2 inputs consist of quoted prices for similar 
instruments.&amp;#160; Level 3 inputs are unobservable inputs and include 
situations where there is little, if any, market activity for the instrument; 
hence, these inputs have the lowest priority.&amp;#160; Mortgage-backed 
securities are recorded based on Level 2 inputs, as such instruments trade in
over-the-counter markets.&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:FairValueMeasurementPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-
01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Cash and Cash 
Equivalents&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;All highly liquid investments with maturities,
when purchased, of three months or less, are considered cash equivalents. These 
balances, as well as cash on hand, are included in &amp;#8220;Cash and cash 
equivalents&amp;#8221; on the balance sheet. As of June 30, 2016, the Fund had 
no cash equivalents. At times, deposits may be in excess of federally insured 
limits, which are $250 thousand per insured financial institution.&amp;#160; As 
of June 30, 2016, the Fund&amp;#8217;s bank balances were maintained in 
uninsured bank accounts at Wells Fargo Bank, N.A.&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock>
    <cik1457919:SalvageFundPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-

italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Salvage 
Fund&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif; color: #000000"&gt;The Fund deposits in a separate 
interest-bearing account, or salvage fund, money to provide for the dismantling 
and removal of production platforms and facilities and plugging and abandoning 
its wells at the end of their useful lives, in accordance with applicable 
federal and state laws and regulations.&amp;#160; As of June 30, 2016 and 
December 31, 2015, the Fund had investments in federal agency mortgage-backed 
securities as detailed in the following table, which are classified as available
for sale.&amp;#160; Available-for-sale securities are carried in the financial 
statements at fair value.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table

bottom"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt
;div style="clear: both"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-
align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The unrealized 
gains on the Fund's investments in federal agency mortgage-backed securities 
were the result of fluctuations in market interest rates. The contractual cash 
flows of those investments are guaranteed by an agency of the U.S. 
government.&amp;#160; Unrealized gains or losses on available-for-sale 
securities are reported in other comprehensive income until 
realized.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;For all investments, interest income is 
accrued as earned and amortization of premium or discount, if any, is included
in interest income.&amp;#160; Interest earned on the account will become part of
the salvage fund.&amp;#160; There are no restrictions on withdrawals from the 
salvage fund.&lt;/div&gt;</cik1457919:SalvageFundPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:DebtPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;Debt Discounts and Deferred Financing 
Costs&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Debt discounts and deferred financing costs include 
lender fees and other costs of acquiring debt (see Note 3. &amp;#8220;Credit 
Agreement &amp;#8211; Beta Project Financing&amp;#8221;) such as the conveyance 
of override royalty interests related to the Beta Project.&amp;#160; These costs
are deferred and amortized over the term of the debt period or until the 
redemption of the debt. During the first quarter of 2016, the Fund adopted the 
accounting guidance issued in April 2015 related to the presentation of debt 
issuance costs on the balance sheet as a direct reduction from the carrying 
amount of the debt liability, rather than as an asset. As a result, the 
unamortized debt discounts and deferred financing costs of $0.2 million as of 
June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015 are presented as&amp;#160;a reduction of 
&amp;#8220;Long-term borrowings&amp;#8221; on the balance sheets. Amortization 
expense was $31 thousand during each of the three months ended June 30, 2016 and
2015. Amortization expense was $0.1 million during each of the six months ended 
June 30, 2016 and 2015.&amp;#160; During the period of asset construction, 
amortization expense, as a component of interest, is capitalized and included on
the balance sheet within &amp;#8220;Oil and gas 
properties&amp;#8221;.&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:DebtPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:FullCostOrSuccessfulEffortsPolicy contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-
06-30">&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Oil and Gas Properties&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The 
Fund invests in oil and gas properties, which are operated by unaffiliated 
entities that are responsible for drilling, administering and producing 
activities pursuant to the terms of the applicable operating agreements with 
working interest owners. The Fund&amp;#8217;s portion of exploration, drilling, 
operating and capital equipment expenditures is billed by 
operators.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Exploration, development and acquisition costs
are accounted for using the successful efforts method. Costs of acquiring 
unproved and proved oil and natural gas leasehold acreage, including lease 
bonuses, brokers&amp;#8217; fees and other related costs are capitalized. Costs 
of drilling and equipping productive wells and related production facilities are
capitalized.&amp;#160; The costs of exploratory wells are capitalized pending 
determination of whether proved reserves have been found. If proved commercial 
reserves are not found, exploratory well costs are expensed as dry-hole 
costs.&amp;#160; At times, the Fund receives adjustments to certain wells from 
their respective operators upon review and audit of the wells&amp;#8217; 
costs.&amp;#160; Interest costs related to the Credit Agreement (see Note 3. 
&amp;#8220;Credit Agreement &amp;#8211; Beta Project Financing&amp;#8221;) are 
capitalized during the period of asset construction.&amp;#160; Annual lease 
rentals and exploration expenses are expensed as incurred.&amp;#160; All costs 
related to production activity and workover efforts are expensed as 
incurred.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Once a well has been 
determined to be fully depleted or upon the sale, retirement or abandonment of a
property, the cost and related accumulated depletion and amortization, if any, 
is eliminated from the property accounts, and the resultant gain or loss is 
recognized.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;As of June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015, 
amounts recorded in due to operators totaling $0.3 million and $0.1 million, 
respectively, related to capital expenditures for oil and gas 
properties.&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:FullCostOrSuccessfulEffortsPolicy>
<cik1457919:AdvancesToOperatorsForWorkingInterestsAndExpendituresPolicyTextBlock
contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font:
italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Advances to Operators for 
Working Interests and Expenditures&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-
align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund may be 
required to advance its share of the estimated succeeding month&amp;#8217;s 
expenditures to the operator for its oil and gas properties. As the costs are 
incurred, the advances are reclassified to proved 
properties.&lt;/div&gt;</cik1457919:AdvancesToOperatorsForWorkingInterestsAndExp
endituresPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:AssetRetirementObligationsPolicy contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-
06-30">&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Asset Retirement 
Obligations&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;For oil and gas properties, there are 
obligations to perform removal and remediation activities when the properties 
are retired. Upon the determination of a property to be either proved or dry, a 
retirement obligation is incurred. The Fund recognizes the fair value of a 
liability for an asset retirement obligation in the period incurred.&amp;#160; 
Plug and abandonment costs associated with unsuccessful projects are expensed as
dry-hole costs.&amp;#160; As indicated above, the Fund maintains a salvage fund 
to provide for the funding of asset retirement obligations.&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:AssetRetirementObligationsPolicy>
    <cik1457919:SyndicationCostsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-
06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; 
font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Syndication 
Costs&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Syndication costs are direct costs incurred by the 
Fund in connection with the offering of the Fund&amp;#8217;s shares, including 
professional fees, selling expenses and administrative costs payable to the 
Manager, an affiliate of the Manager and unaffiliated broker-dealers, which are 
reflected on the Fund&amp;#8217;s balance sheet as a reduction of 
shareholders&amp;#8217; 
capital.&lt;/div&gt;</cik1457919:SyndicationCostsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:RevenueRecognitionPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-
06-30">&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Revenue Recognition and 
Imbalances&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Oil and gas revenues are recognized when oil 
and gas is sold to a purchaser at a fixed or determinable price, when delivery 
has occurred and title has transferred, and collectability of the revenue is 
reasonably assured.&amp;#160; The Fund uses the sales method of accounting for 
gas production imbalances.&amp;#160; The volumes of gas sold may differ from the
volumes to which the Fund is entitled based on its interests in the 
properties.&amp;#160; These differences create imbalances that are recognized as
a liability only when the properties&amp;#8217; estimated remaining reserves net
to the Fund will not be sufficient to enable the underproduced owner to recoup 
its entitled share through production.&amp;#160; The Fund&amp;#8217;s recorded 
liability, if any, would be reflected in other liabilities.&amp;#160; No 
receivables are recorded for those wells where the Fund has taken less than its 
share of production.&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:RevenueRecognitionPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ImpairmentOrDisposalOfLongLivedAssetsPolicyTextBlock 
contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The 
Fund reviews the carrying value of its oil and gas properties annually and when 
management determines that events and circumstances indicate that the recorded 
carrying value of properties may not be recoverable.&amp;#160; Impairments are 
determined by comparing estimated future net undiscounted cash flows to the 
carrying value at the time of the review.&amp;#160; If the carrying value 
exceeds the estimated future net undiscounted cash flows, the carrying value of 
the asset is written down to fair value, which is determined using estimated
future net discounted cash flows from the asset.&amp;#160; The fair value 
determinations require considerable judgment and are sensitive to 
change.&amp;#160; Different pricing assumptions, reserve estimates or discount 
rates could result in a different calculated impairment.&amp;#160; Given the 
volatility of oil and natural gas prices, it is reasonably possible that the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s estimate of discounted future net cash flows from proved oil 
and natural gas reserves could change in the near 
term.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Significant declines in oil and natural gas 
prices since fourth quarter 2014 have impacted the fair value of the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s oil and gas properties. If oil and natural gas prices continue 
to decline, even if only for a short period of time, it is possible that 
impairments of oil and gas properties will occur.&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:ImpairmentOrDisposalOfLongLivedAssetsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-
01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Depletion and 
Amortization&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Depletion and amortization of the cost of 
proved oil and gas properties are calculated using the units-of-production 
method.&amp;#160; Proved developed reserves are used as the base for depleting 
capitalized costs associated with successful exploratory well costs, development
costs and related facilities. The sum of proved developed and proved undeveloped
reserves is used as the base for depleting or amortizing leasehold acquisition 
costs.&amp;#160; During the three and six months ended June 30, 2015, the Fund 
recorded $0.6 million of depletion expense related to adjustments to asset 
retirement obligations for fully depleted properties.&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-
30">&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, serif"&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;No provision is made for 
income taxes in the financial statements.&amp;#160; The Fund is a limited 
liability company, and as such, the Fund&amp;#8217;s income or loss is passed 
through and included in the tax returns of the Fund&amp;#8217;s 
shareholders.&amp;#160; The Fund files U.S. Federal and State tax returns and 
the 2013 through 2015 tax returns remain open for examination by tax 
authorities.&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock>
    <cik1457919:IncomeAndExpenseAllocationPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-
01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Income and Expense 
Allocation&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Profits and losses are allocated to 
shareholders and the Manager in accordance with the LLC 
Agreement.&lt;/div&gt;</cik1457919:IncomeAndExpenseAllocationPolicyTextBlock>
    <cik1457919:DistributionsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-
30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 
italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;Distributions&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify;
font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Distributions to shareholders are 
allocated in proportion to the number of shares held.&amp;#160; The Manager 
determines whether available cash from operations, as defined in the LLC 
Agreement, will be distributed. Such distributions are allocated 85% to the 
shareholders and 15% to the Manager, as required by the LLC 
Agreement.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Available cash from dispositions, as defined 
in the LLC Agreement, will be paid 99% to shareholders and 1% to the Manager 
until the shareholders have received total distributions equal to their capital 
contributions. After shareholders have received distributions equal to their 
capital contributions, 85% of available cash from dispositions will be 
distributed to shareholders and 15% to the 
Manager.&lt;/div&gt;</cik1457919:DistributionsPolicyTextBlock>
<us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-
01-01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align:
left; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Recent Accounting
Pronouncements&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;In April 2015, the Financial Accounting 
Standards Board (&amp;#8220;FASB&amp;#8221;) issued accounting guidance related 
to the presentation of debt issuance costs on the balance sheet as a direct 
reduction from the carrying amount of the debt liability, consistent with debt 
discounts, rather than as an asset.&amp;#160; Amortization of debt issuance 
costs will continue to be reported as interest expense.&amp;#160; In August 
2015, the FASB issued accounting guidance related to the presentation and 
subsequent measurement of debt issuance costs associated with line-of-credit 
arrangements which clarifies that companies may continue to present unamortized 
debt issuance costs associated with line of credit arrangements as an 
asset.&amp;#160; These pronouncements are effective for fiscal years, and 
interim periods within those years, beginning after December 15, 2015, with 
early adoption permitted.&amp;#160; The Fund adopted the accounting guidance in 
first quarter 2016, resulting in a one-time reclassification of $0.2 million of 
unamortized debt discounts and deferred financing costs from "Other assets" to 
"Long-term borrowings" on the balance sheet as of December 31, 2015. Long-term 
borrowings are presented net of $0.2 million of unamortized debt discounts and 
deferred financing costs as of June 30, 2016. The adoption of these 
pronouncements did not impact the Fund&amp;#8217;s results of operations or cash
flows.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;In 2014, the FASB issued accounting guidance 
on revenue recognition, which provides for a single five-step model to be 
applied to all revenue contracts with customers. In 2015, the FASB issued a 
deferral of the effective date of the guidance to 2018, with early adoption 
permitted in 2017. In May 2016, the FASB issued final amendments which provided 
narrow scope improvements and practical expedients related to the implementation
of the guidance. The Fund is currently evaluating the impact of this guidance on
its financial statements.&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_dei_EntityFilerCategory">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Indicate whether the registrant is one of the following: 
(1) Large Accelerated Filer, (2) Accelerated Filer, (3) Non-accelerated Filer, 
(4) Smaller Reporting Company (Non-accelerated) or (5) Smaller Reporting 
Accelerated Filer. Definitions of these categories are stated in Rule 12b-2 of 
the Exchange Act. This information should be based on the registrant's current 
or most recent filing containing the related disclosure.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>No definition available.</p></div>
